gods.name: Zeus
pros: Strong infantry, especially Hoplites.
Thunderbolt god power deals direct damage to units.
Favors direct military confrontations.
cons: Lacks strong economic bonuses.
Naval power weaker compared to Poseidon.

guides.title: Greek Build Order Guide (Hades, Zeus, Poseidon) by IamMagic

gods.name: Hades
pros: Defensive playstyle with fortified structures.
Shades (ghost soldiers) return after death to keep fighting.
Great for long, drawn-out battles.
cons: Slow economic growth compared to other gods.
Lacks early-game aggression.

guides.title: Greek Build Order Guide (Hades, Zeus, Poseidon) by IamMagic

gods.name: Poseidon
pros: Strong naval power, ideal for water-heavy maps.
Cavalry units benefit from bonuses like the Hetairos cavalry unit.
Lure god power attracts animals for easy food collection.
cons: Not as strong on land-focused maps.
Fewer bonuses for infantry compared to other Greek gods.

guides.title: Greek Build Order Guide (Hades, Zeus, Poseidon) by IamMagic

gods.name: Isis
pros: Great economic growth, especially favor generation through monuments.
Prevents enemy god powers from being used within influence.
Strong defensive bonuses with empowered healing.
cons: Less emphasis on offensive military power.
Slow to ramp up without resource boosts early on.

guides.title: Egyptian Guide - Ra, Isis, Set by FitzBro

gods.name: Ra
pros: Superior farming boosts that drive rapid economic growth.
Empowers buildings to work more efficiently.
Strong myth units and large armies.
cons: Less aggressive early game.
Relies heavily on farming economy, which can be vulnerable.

guides.title: Egyptian Guide - Ra, Isis, Set by FitzBro

gods.name: Set
pros: Converts wild animals for a unique military advantage.
Excellent scouting with animal control and map vision.
Strong in chaos and disruption tactics.
cons: Relies heavily on map control and wild animals for full potential.
Weaker economy without natural boosts like Ra or Isis.

guides.title: Egyptian Guide - Ra, Isis, Set by FitzBro

gods.name: Thor
pros: Dwarves gather resources faster, boosting economy.
Powerful siege units like Portable Rams.
Frost Giants can freeze enemies, giving an advantage in combat.
cons: Not as infantry-focused as other Norse gods.
Can be vulnerable to strong early pressure without economic buildup.

gods.name: Odin
pros: Ravens provide free scouting from the start, allowing excellent map control.
Strong infantry units and myth units like Valkyries that heal troops.
Boosts to Ulfsarks allow for rapid building and combat efficiency.
cons: Requires strong infantry micro-management for full effectiveness.
Less flexibility compared to Thor in terms of resource gathering.

gods.name: Loki
pros: Guerrilla tactics with myth units summoned during combat.
Hersirs can spawn myth units by fighting, adding randomness to battles.
Emphasizes chaos and surprise attacks.
cons: Riskier playstyle due to reliance on myth units for success.
Weaker traditional economy and army compared to other gods.

guides.title: Loki Build Order and Follow Through!

gods.name: Oranos
pros: High mobility with the ability to teleport buildings.
Shockwave god power disrupts enemy formations.
Enhanced speed for Atlantean units for better map control.
cons: Weaker in long, drawn-out battles.
Less focus on direct military strength and more on mobility.

gods.name: Kronos
pros: Manipulates the battlefield by shifting buildings and using time-based strategies.
Deconstruction god power can dismantle enemy buildings temporarily.
Great for surprise assaults and flexible tactics.
cons: Vulnerable in long sieges and requires strategic planning to excel.
Lacks strong direct military bonuses.

guides.title: Kronos/ 2:30 Advance Build Order by KeeN Gaming

gods.name: Gaia
pros: Strong defense with self-healing buildings from terrain.
Prevents enemy buildings from regenerating health within her influence.
Great for players who prefer turtling and holding strong positions.
cons: Lacks strong offensive military powers.
Can struggle against fast, aggressive opponents.

guides.title: Gaia Eco Boom Build Order Guide
